Jekyll Data Files

An overview of data files in Jekyll. Further information can be found on the Jekyll website.

Contents
Introduction
Data folder
Example usage

Introduction

Jekyll accepts custom data, which is accessed via the Liquid template engine. It supports loading data from YAML, JSON, and CSV files, which are stored in _data directory.

NB: CSV files must contain a header row.

Data folder

In Jekyll, the _data folder is used to store additional data for processing during the site build. These data files must be YAML compliant, and a .yml, .yaml, .json or csv file extension is supported. These data files are also accessible via site.data.

Example usage

A data file might be used to store repetitive data, such as a group or member list, to avoid tedious duplication throughout a site. For example, a list can be stored in _data/members.yml, and then accessed via site.data.members. The filename determines the variable name.

We could then access this data as follows,


{% for member in site.data.members %}
{{ member.name }}
{% endfor %}

Data files can also be stored in sub-folders of the _data folder. Each hierarchical level is then added to the variable's namespace.
